intro: Cheiropleuria bicuspis var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved cheiropleuria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its elongated, opposite leaves that are entire, giving it its varietal name "integrifolia." The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
